summary: EVERYTHING WE KNOW ABOUT THE FINAL SEASON OF GAME OF THRONES
title: EVERYTHING WE KNOW ABOUT THE FINAL SEASON OF GAME OF THRONES
body:
Here’s everything we know about the final season of Game of Thrones!

The season will consist of 6 episodes only, and each one will be feature-length (at least 60 minutes each). The season will premiere during the first half of 2019, most probably in April but no official release date yet.

David Nutter (directed of the Red Wedding) will direct 3 episodes this season, including the premiere. Miguel Sapochnik (Battle of the B*stards) will direct 2 episodes, & the show’s creators,  David Benioff & D.B. Weiss will direct the very last episode.

The battle scenes will be more epic (as expected). One feature-length episode is set to focus entirely on a MAJOR battle which took 55 days to film. Peter Dinklage, who plays Tyion, has said this season makes the BotB “look like a theme park”.

Sophie Turner has said the finale is “bloodier than ever. It’s full of betrayal, full of war, full of danger”.

Sophie Turner described the ending as “satisfying”, while Peter Dinklage said the showrunners ”end it brilliantly. Better than I could have imagined, and you people are in for it. It ends beautifully for my character – whether it be tragic or not.”

There’s a new character! Harry Strickland, played by Marc Rissmann, is the leader of the Golden Company, the group of mercenaries that Cersei hires with Euron Greyjoy. There are other new characters but we know nothing about them.

*MILD SPOILERS AHEAD FOR SEASON 8*

- Ghost (Jon’s direwolf) is back

- The season is going to open with Daenerys’ tense arrival in Winterfell meeting the Starks, it is described as being similar to Robert’s arrival in season 1

Here’s everything we know about the final season of Game of Thrones!

The season will consist of 6 episodes only, and each one will be feature-length (at least 60 minutes each). The season will premiere during the first half of 2019, most probably in April but no official release date yet.

David Nutter (directed of the Red Wedding) will direct 3 episodes this season, including the premiere. Miguel Sapochnik (Battle of the B*stards) will direct 2 episodes, & the show’s creators,  David Benioff & D.B. Weiss will direct the very last episode.

The battle scenes will be more epic (as expected). One feature-length episode is set to focus entirely on a MAJOR battle which took 55 days to film. Peter Dinklage, who plays Tyion, has said this season makes the BotB “look like a theme park”.

Sophie Turner has said the finale is “bloodier than ever. It’s full of betrayal, full of war, full of danger”.

Sophie Turner described the ending as “satisfying”, while Peter Dinklage said the showrunners ”end it brilliantly. Better than I could have imagined, and you people are in for it. It ends beautifully for my character – whether it be tragic or not.”

There’s a new character! Harry Strickland, played by Marc Rissmann, is the leader of the Golden Company, the group of mercenaries that Cersei hires with Euron Greyjoy. There are other new characters but we know nothing about them.

*MILD SPOILERS AHEAD FOR SEASON 8*

- Ghost (Jon’s direwolf) is back

- The season is going to open with Daenerys’ tense arrival in Winterfell meeting the Starks, it is described as being similar to Robert’s arrival in season 1

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

summary: Touch
title: Touch
body:
Written for @jonsadrabbles Day 2: Essos OR Touch

Jon and Sansa spend their evening looking at the stars, talking and touching.

Modern AU, college AU, stargazing AU

There was something magical about the dark. Maybe it was the absolute silence, because most people were asleep. Maybe it was the promise of nice dreams of anything that could and couldn’t happen. Or maybe it was because it was when Jon and Sansa had the most deep conversations about whatever their hearts desired and longed for.

Jon stared at the million stars above his head. He had read somewhere that looking at the stars was looking at the past, at something that has been, but probably wasn’t anymore. He had to admit that it wasn’t a very romantic explanation. But he had never been very romantic anyway. Not until he had met her at least.

“A penny for your thoughts.” Sansa turned towards him. She folded her hands under her head and a smile spread across her angelic face. And all those million stars and reflections of the past glimmered in her eyes.

Jon cleared his throat. “You don’t wanna know.” He faced her and pulled one leg up to make himself a little more comfortable. “It was something scientific and boring.”

A soft chuckle escaped Sansa’s lips and she wiped a few dark black curls from his face. “My little professor.” She whispered, but instead of pulling her hand back she touched his cheek and his neck.

A shiver rolled down his spine and he curled his fingers around her wrist. “My little angel.” He closed his eyes and couldn’t help but think that there had never been a better and more beautiful moment than this. “What and who would I be without you?”

Lost. Stuck in study books, Locked up in libraries because he forgot the time. Overworked and exhausted too, probably.

“Did you know that Plato stated that every human was born with four feet and four arms?” Sansa moved a little closer towards him and she placed her head on his chest. “They became so powerful that the Gods were forced to destroy them. They split them up in two parts, and since that day we alway longs for our other half.”

Jon curled his lips up into a smile and he pressed a soft kiss on her forehead. “Technically Aristophanos presented that story. Plato wrote it down, but still.”

Sansa pushed herself up and shook her head. “One day, Jon Snow.” She tapped the tip of his nose. “One day I’ll be able to tell you something you don’t know yet.”

“There is a lot I don’t know yet.” Jon let the tips of his fingers wander over her back. “But I guess most things need to be shown and not told.”

“I will show you everything.” Sansa sat up again and straddled him. “Everything you already know, everything you know you don’t know and everything you don’t know you don’t know.”

Jon smiled. “I always thought Aristophanos was wrong.” Jon stretched out his hand and touched her face. “But maybe he wasn’t.”

summary: Daenerys Targaryen Dorne or Braavos? Did Jon and Dany met in past?
title: Daenerys Targaryen Dorne or Braavos? Did Jon and Dany met in past?
body:
“That was when they lived in Braavos, in the big house with the red door. Dany had her own room there, with a lemon tree outside her window”

Nut there is no tree in Braavos. especially Lemon tree. Lemon is Dornish culture. 

lemon trees only grow in the correct climate - and the only correct climate in Westeros is likely to be Dorne. Braavos has neither the sunshine, nor the freshwater needed to grow lemon trees. GRRM reminds us again and again, via Arya and Sam, that trees rarely grow in Braavos.

Braavos, devoid of grass and trees. Braavos is all stone, a grey city in a green sea.

Dareon said thar ‘’ Trees did not grow on Braavos ‘’

there are no trees in Braavos. But if it is true. where were Daenerys Targaryen during this time?

Of course she was in Dorne

After Robert’s rebelion . Robert ordered his brother about Dany and Viserys. Targaryen’s followers separated children. They took dany in Braavos and Viserys in Free citys. In Dany’s earlier memories is not his brother.

There is another moment. Daenerys  knows Valyrian language. but there is no moment in book or show if we think that Viserys knew Valyrian too. Viserys never spoke to Valyrian language. Where does Daenerys knows Valyrian?

There is only answer of this question. Vhen Stanis traveled to Dragonstone Targaryen’s advisors separated children. They took dany in Braavos with Maester of Dragonstone. Maester taught her the Valyrian  language.

Dany’s another memory. 
No, this is not a memoir
These are fragments from her mind,not a memory 

‘‘ Sometimes she would close her eyes and dream of him, but it was never Jorah Mormont she dreamed of; her lover was always younger and more comely, though his face remained a shifting shadow.“ (ACOK - Dany) ‘‘

Yeah this is fact that in her dreams is Jon but why Jon? How Jon? 

‘‘Daenerys dreamer’‘ _This isn’s only nickname. Targaryen’s womans are known as  prophetic  dreams. 

Dany sees what he has seen in the past?

 Ned Stark found Lyanna in tower of Joy.Lyanna promised him her  baby but Ned Stark couldn’t take a baby in Winterfell immediatelly. Everybody could  understand that he was Lyannas baby.  He left baby behind and  returned in Winterfell. Ned Stark’s bastard came to the light after  year or 1  year and half. 

But where was the baby all this time? In Dorne? 

If Targaryen’s  Advisors took Dany in Dorne after storm of Dragonstone.   I Don’t know how but they were similar place. Jon was only 1 years old. probably Dany 2 or 3 month but she is a dreamer.  

Dany thinks about her comely lovers who is some age but this isn’t memory. This is only pragment of her mind. That’s what hers mind has already seen and remembered.

Dany’s mind remembers Jon’s face. She is a Daenerys Dreamer. 

thanks!

there are no trees in Braavos. But if it is true. where were Daenerys Targaryen during this time?

Of course she was in Dorne

After Robert’s rebelion . Robert ordered his brother about Dany and Viserys. Targaryen’s followers separated children. They took dany in Braavos and Viserys in Free citys. In Dany’s earlier memories is not his brother.

There is another moment. Daenerys  knows Valyrian language. but there is no moment in book or show if we think that Viserys knew Valyrian too. Viserys never spoke to Valyrian language. Where does Daenerys knows Valyrian?

There is only answer of this question. Vhen Stanis traveled to Dragonstone Targaryen’s advisors separated children. They took dany in Braavos with Maester of Dragonstone. Maester taught her the Valyrian  language.

Dany’s another memory. 
No, this is not a memoir
These are fragments from her mind,not a memory 

‘‘ Sometimes she would close her eyes and dream of him, but it was never Jorah Mormont she dreamed of; her lover was always younger and more comely, though his face remained a shifting shadow.“ (ACOK - Dany) ‘‘

Yeah this is fact that in her dreams is Jon but why Jon? How Jon? 

‘‘Daenerys dreamer’‘ _This isn’s only nickname. Targaryen’s womans are known as  prophetic  dreams. 

Dany sees what he has seen in the past?

 Ned Stark found Lyanna in tower of Joy.Lyanna promised him her  baby but Ned Stark couldn’t take a baby in Winterfell immediatelly. Everybody could  understand that he was Lyannas baby.  He left baby behind and  returned in Winterfell. Ned Stark’s bastard came to the light after  year or 1  year and half. 

But where was the baby all this time? In Dorne? 

If Targaryen’s  Advisors took Dany in Dorne after storm of Dragonstone.   I Don’t know how but they were similar place. Jon was only 1 years old. probably Dany 2 or 3 month but she is a dreamer.  

Dany thinks about her comely lovers who is some age but this isn’t memory. This is only pragment of her mind. That’s what hers mind has already seen and remembered.

Dany’s mind remembers Jon’s face. She is a Daenerys Dreamer. 

thanks!
trail.content:
“That was when they lived in Braavos, in the big house with the red door. Dany had her own room there, with a lemon tree outside her window”

Nut there is no tree in Braavos. especially Lemon tree. Lemon is Dornish culture. 

lemon trees only grow in the correct climate - and the only correct climate in Westeros is likely to be Dorne. Braavos has neither the sunshine, nor the freshwater needed to grow lemon trees. GRRM reminds us again and again, via Arya and Sam, that trees rarely grow in Braavos.

Braavos, devoid of grass and trees. Braavos is all stone, a grey city in a green sea.

Dareon said thar ‘’ Trees did not grow on Braavos ‘’

there are no trees in Braavos. But if it is true. where were Daenerys Targaryen during this time?

Of course she was in Dorne

After Robert’s rebelion . Robert ordered his brother about Dany and Viserys. Targaryen’s followers separated children. They took dany in Braavos and Viserys in Free citys. In Dany’s earlier memories is not his brother.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary:
He won’t go so far as to relate the events in his books to today’s 
politics, but he hopes that Westeros offers us lessons,...
body:
He won’t go so far as to relate the events in his books to today’s politics, but he hopes that Westeros offers us lessons, including the ways that power can corrupt. “Maybe some kid who is reading it now…will be a president or senator, and the lessons of Westeros will have been incorporated into his worldview and affect some decision he makes 20 or 30 years from now.” Then he pauses to think. “It depends on who he models himself on, Jon Snow or a new Joffrey,” citing a noble hero and a sadistic boy king. “We don’t need anyone modeling themselves after Joffrey.”  - GRRM

https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-game-of-thrones-author-george-r-r-martin-assures-fans-writing-is-coming-1542390476?mod=hp_lead_pos10

blog.name: athimbleful

summary: *spoilers* (i guess) helloo! do you think jon will die a third time in season 8? there's a say in where i live that it's never...
question: *spoilers* (i guess) helloo! do you think jon will die a third time in season 8? there's a say in where i live that it's never two without three so... maybe?
answer:
Hello!

I’m not really following? As far as I know, Jon has only died once. So either you mean that he’ll die again, get resurrected, and die a third time in s8. Or that he has a third life after dying the second time? Or am I missing something lol?

Either way, no, I don’t think he’ll die again. S8 will most likely have him doing some dishonorable stuff and he should have to live with those consequences and come to terms with what he’s done and the choices he’s made. Death in fiction can be an easy way out and therefore rather boring. And Jon being a Perfect Pure Hero who does nothing wrong and then sacrifices himself for the greater good would be uninspired and not feel very GRRM. And he’s already been murdered once, so that would bring nothing new to the table either–especially not if it’s someone who betrays him. And Jon being injured in the war and dying afterwards seems unnecessary to me, because why drag that out?

In a convo I had the other day, someone suggested a mercy killing (if you see this, I’ll add your name if you want), where Arya would put Jon out of his misery and I can see the sense in that. Especially considering that she didn’t do that to the Hound. If they want a tear-jerker, that would be a good way of doing it. I still doubt it, though. I find it really odd to make him the “rightful” heir to the Iron Throne for the sole purpose of being a rival to D/ny and then kill him off. It has to lead somewhere or he could’ve just been Ned Stark’s bastard.

But say Jon dies. If he dies, I think he’ll stay dead. They’ve already done the death + resurrection bit and, unless you’re doing it for a good reason, it’s a cop-out. So repeating it would be nothing but cheap. It weakens any emotional punch the death had and is, frankly, insulting to the audience and characters. It’s not something I think GRRM would do. And while D&D aren’t fantastic writers, I also don’t think they’re cowards. They like inflicting pain on the audience, so if they have a choice, I don’t think they’d pull a second resurrection either.

The saying you mention is something GRRM is fond of, though, as far as I understand it. But I think it’ll feature in different ways. Like, perhaps a third trial for Tyrion, a third marriage for Sansa, or a third fire for Dany etc.

Thanks for the ask!

summary: Love Island Westeros
title: Love Island Westeros
description:
by poutingsliver

Welcome to Love Island!

11 lovely singles are about to battle it out in the game of love. Will they find what they’re looking for? Or will they leave just as single? Will they make it to the end? Or be booted too soon? Find out on Love Island Westeros! From the North to Meereen meet our 11 singles and decide who you’re rooting for, get ready it’s about to be wild.

(The Love Island AU that no one asked for)

Words: 1806, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms, Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Multi

  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Myrcella Baratheon/Robb Stark
  • Additional Tags: not related AU, Love Island - Freeform, lots of relationships

summary: Jonsa Drabbles - day 2
body:
Jonsa Drabbles - day 2

Essos | Touch

Sansa Stark, Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. Sometimes, she has to pinch herself to prove that everything is not a dream. All she ever wanted, her entire life, was to be where she is.

Except it’s not really how she wanted.

The Targaryen king, this mad husband of hers, is insanely jealous. His word is law as everyone both fears and loves him, so Sansa can never really complain or question his decisions.

Only women may attend to her, except the Kingsguard. Not even Grand Maester Pycelle can see to her, with his hungry eyes and wandering hands. He says this all as if he’s protecting her from those around her, trying to preserve her innocence.

Another one of his rules is that no one can touch the queen. Sansa never truly understands why.

Her first son is born when she is six and ten, a chubby little boy with dark gray hair and clear Tully eyes. Maegal looks like the king’s second son, the bastard and Lord Commander of the Kingsguard. His mother was a Stark, like her, so no one questions. He will sit on the Iron Throne one day.

A daughter comes next with silver hair and violet eyes, almost inhumanly beautiful. Sansa falls in love at first sight, her entire days spent by her side. Shaera is hers, in a way her brother can never be.

“Our children are beautiful,” their father says, entering her chambers at the hour of the wolf, when no one can hear them. “You’ve made me the happiest man on land.”

“Come here,” she answers, tugging on the laces of his white breeches, “Give me another pup, Jon.”

No one can touch her, but Sansa always makes an exception for Jaehaerys Snow.

Her first son is born when she is six and ten, a chubby little boy with dark gray hair and clear Tully eyes. Maegal looks like the king’s second son, the bastard and Lord Commander of the Kingsguard. His mother was a Stark, like her, so no one questions. He will sit on the Iron Throne one day.

A daughter comes next with silver hair and violet eyes, almost inhumanly beautiful. Sansa falls in love at first sight, her entire days spent by her side. Shaera is hers, in a way her brother can never be.

“Our children are beautiful,” their father says, entering her chambers at the hour of the wolf, when no one can hear them. “You’ve made me the happiest man on land.”

“Come here,” she answers, tugging on the laces of his white breeches, “Give me another pup, Jon.”

No one can touch her, but Sansa always makes an exception for Jaehaerys Snow.

blog.name: turtle-paced
blog.title: turtle-paced
blog.description: Writing at the speed of the race course paradox.

summary: I'm wondering why you think Jon's going to reconnect with his Stark 'siblings' instead the more likely path of him embracing his...
question: I'm wondering why you think Jon's going to reconnect with his Stark 'siblings' instead the more likely path of him embracing his heritage as a Targaryen (dragon riding, Dany, fulfilling Rhaegar's prophecy)? Given that Jon gets killed for being trying to be a Stark (he reminisces about those siblings before he dies), Aemon's warnings about killing the boy and letting the man be born. Isn't him coming into his own as a Targaryen Prince much more thematically foreshadowed?
answer:
Simple - I don’t agree that it’s more likely Jon embraces his Targaryen heritage over his Stark heritage, and I don’t agree that this is more heavily thematically foreshadowed. Quite the reverse. I don’t see why Jon’s murder would cause him to reject the Stark family, and I read “kill the boy and let the man be born” as a comment on Jon’s maturity rather than his family identity.

Jon is established right at the beginning of the story as a member of the Stark family, even though he is somewhat set apart from them. He’s subject to the party scattering that the rest of the family is, and so he’ll be drawn back to Winterfell with the rest of his siblings. We see again and again and again through his story just how much he loves his siblings, and so I don’t think he’ll drop them like rocks because he found a shinier heritage. It’s a point of note regarding his bastardy that one of the things he hates about it is how it makes him not truly a part of the Stark family. 

We also know that Jon is proud of being Ned’s son. The reveal that Rhaegar’s his bio-dad, and the realisation of everything that came from Rhaegar’s desire to have Jon is not the sort of thing this character can celebrate. Jon grew up knowing how reluctant Ned was to speak of Jon’s mother; he can work out just how much grief all of Westeros went through for Rhaegar’s prophetic vision. I think it’s far more likely that Jon is horrified and rejects said vision.

If Jon fulfils Rhaegar’s prophecy, I doubt it has anything to do with Rhaegar, and everything to do with what Ned taught him was the right thing to do.

tags: I love writing about friendship and loneliness
summary: ‘Thank you,’ Jon smiled. He liked Gendry. Sometimes being around him felt like he was back at the Wall with Sam, or exchanging...
text:
‘Thank you,’ Jon smiled. He liked Gendry. Sometimes being around him felt like he was back at the Wall with Sam, or exchanging dirty japes at Winterfell’s Great Hall with Robb. He wasn’t Lord Commander or King of the North to them. He was just another lad. And they were his friends.

Friends. Aye, I’ve missed having those.
source: The Jonsa Fic I’m currently working on

body:
Jonsa fans speak how different is Jon and Sansa hug. But it’s not.

Sansa hugged Bran with similar manner



Jon Hugged Arya with similar manner

Maybe this is a Sophies own manner. She always hugged her partner like that.

J0nsas are always lier
